result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J. Axelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, DNA surcharges, and Drug Money reimbursement. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Complete a psychological assessment if one has been done and comply with treatment recommendations.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription and unless Defendant is taking those controlled substances.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Submit DNA sample if not done so.

Defendant Kenneth J. Axelson in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent is also present.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-227 and 15CF-313.

1:39 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a sentencing hearing today. Defendant previously plead.

Court ordered a PSI. Copies were forwarded to counsel.  

Atty Knaapen has no corrections from a factual standpoint.

Atty Drengler has reviewed the report with his client, has no corrections to state.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing, makes sentencing recommendations.
State recommends in 15CF-227: Ct 1: 18 months in initial, 5 yrs extended supervision; Ct 4: 18 month in initial, 3 yrs extended, concurrent to Ct 1;
Ct 5: 12 months in initial, 12 months extended, concurrent to Ct 1 and Ct 4
State recommends in 15CF-313: 6 month jail sentence concurrent to 15CF-227.
Buy money is cost - $1,050, to be paid out of prison account, balance to be paid on extended supervision.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court prior to sentencing, makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Drengler recommends upwards of 5 years probation with no jail time, possibility of early discharge, imposed and stayed prison sentence, 1 day credit. Eligible for substance abuse program.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

20 days in which to appeal the case.
Parties will keep their copies of the PSI report, reminded to keep them confidential.

2:23 PM Court is in recess.
Sentencing hearing on June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth J. Axelson in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF227, 15CF313
2:04 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF227 Counts 1, 4 & 5 - NO CONTEST
15CF313 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF227 Counts 1, 4 & 5, 15CF313 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read-in are the following:  15CF227 Counts 2, 3 & 6 thru 11 and 15CF313 Count 2. 
Court orders PSI. 
PSI be completed by 6/3/2016 with copies forwarded to counsel. 
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
